Enhanced Postnatal Prophylaxis
Enhanced Adherence Counselling
Objective: The Enhanced Adherence Counselling Register is used to track PLHIV on ART with unsuppressed viral load. To be completed by the Adherence Counsellor or service provider responsible for EAC
Name: Unique ID: Hospital Number:  Age: Gender:
Weight:kg Height: cm CD4 Count: c/mm 3
Viral Load:copies/ml Regimen:ART Start Date:
S/NPast Viral Load Results Date (Sample Collection)
TOPICS FOR IAC SESSIONS
1ST SESSION: Provide group specific counseling to include:
Review VL investigation and meaning of VL results
Review past adherence history and discuss
Identify and address obstacles/barriers to medications (non-disclosure, poor adherence, storage of drugs, treatment support, distance to health facility, substance/alcohol use, condom use, multiple partners, herbal/over the counter medications etc)
Discuss how ARVs work and Resistance
Discuss adherence reminders/tools – Phone alarm, Pill boxes, specific TV/Radio programs
Discuss with M&E and give 2 weeks appointment
Discuss index case testing (ICT) services
Educate and supply condom at every clinic visit
Assign TSS to follow up client in the community
Explore for more questions and concerns (discuss)
Discuss importance of treatment partner (TP) and encourage to have TP
TOPICS FOR IAC SESSIONS
2ND SESSION: Provide Detailed Adherence counseling including:
Review 1st session discussion, what client has done differently to achieve viral suppression
Has the client identified a Treatment partner (TP)?
Discuss the consequences of non-adherence to medication, appointment and laboratory investigations
Discuss how to prevent disease progression and further infections
Provide IPT prophylaxis if eligible
Confirm availability of support services
TOPICS FOR IAC SESSIONS
3RD SESSION:
Discuss date or refer & link for repeat viral load test
Discuss 2nd line regimen
Discuss and link client to Community Support group
Confirm availability of support services
ARV Plan
Referrals
TB Services PMTCT Services
Social Support STI Services
